item.title: 拜耳获得 Cytokinetics 心脏药物在日本的销售权
item.description: 拜耳公司周二与美国生物技术公司 Cytokinetics 达成合作协议，获得一种试验性心脏药物在日本的部分权利，德国拜耳集团正通过小型交易加强其心血管业务。【原文：Bayer on Tuesday struck a collaboration deal with U.S. biotech firm Cytokinetics to acquire certain rights in Japan to an experimental heart drug, as the German group strengthens its cardiovascular business with smaller deals.】

item.title: 雀巢将在首席执行官弗莱克西的领导下削减成本、加强营销
item.description: 雀巢公司周二表示，在新任首席执行官洛朗-弗莱克西（Laurent Freixe）的领导下，雀巢将加强广告和营销，削减成本，将水和高端饮料业务划分为一个独立的全球部门，并实施其他变革以推动增长。【原文：Nestle will boost advertising and marketing, trim costs, carve out its water and premium drinks businesses into a standalone global unit, and implement other changes to drive growth under new chief Laurent Freixe, the company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称索尼正在洽谈收购《艾登戒指》背后的媒体公司
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，索尼正在洽谈收购角川公司，这家日本媒体公司是 "Elden Ring "游戏的幕后推手。【原文：Sony is in talks to acquire Kadokawa , the Japanese media powerhouse behind the "Elden Ring" game, two sources familiar with the matter said, as the technology giant looks to add to its entertainment portfolio.】

item.title: 高盛预测标普 500 指数 2025 年底目标为 6500 点，加入摩根士丹利的行列
item.description: 在美国经济和企业盈利持续增长的背景下，高盛（Goldman Sachs）与摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）一道预测，到 2025 年底，S&P 500 指数将达到 6500 点。【原文：Goldman Sachs has forecast the S&P 500 index would reach 6,500 by the end of 2025, joining peer Morgan Stanley, on the back of continued growth in the U.S. economy and corporate earnings.】

item.title: 早间竞价：交易员关注美联储，等待特朗普关键人选
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织警告亚洲报复性关税可能破坏经济增长
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）周二警告说，"针锋相对 "的关税可能会破坏亚洲的经济前景、提高成本并扰乱供应链，尽管该组织预计亚洲仍将是全球经济增长的主要引擎。【原文：The International Monetary Fund (IMF) warned on Tuesday that "tit-for-tat" tariffs could undermine Asia's economic prospects, raise costs and disrupt supply chains even as it expects the region to remain a key engine of growth for the global economy.】

item.title: 伊朗和以色列等对手将在越南防务展上展示武器
item.description: 越南国防部周二表示，来自伊朗、以色列、中国、俄罗斯和美国的公司将于 12 月在河内举行的武器博览会上展示军事装备，这是地缘政治竞争对手共同展示商品的罕见案例。【原文：Companies from Iran, Israel, China, Russia and the United States will showcase military equipment at an arms expo in Hanoi in December, Vietnam's defence ministry said on Tuesday, a rare case of geopolitical rivals exhibiting their wares together.】

item.title: 投资者重新押注日本加息
item.description: 投资者押注日元汇率下滑将迫使日本央行转向鹰派，他们正在做空债券、买入银行股，并为最快于下个月升息做好准备。【原文：Investors are betting a slide in the yen will force a hawkish shift at the Bank of Japan and are shorting bonds, buying bank shares and bracing for rates to rise as soon as next month.】

item.title: 澳大利亚赛约纳矿业公司收购美国皮德蒙特锂公司
item.description: 澳大利亚赛约纳矿业公司（Sayona Mining）周二表示，它将收购总部位于美国的皮德蒙特锂公司（Piedmont Lithium），这笔交易将巩固双方在加拿大的业务，同时加强在北美电动汽车行业的风险敞口，其中包括皮德蒙特的客户特斯拉公司（Tesla）。【原文：Australia's Sayona Mining said on Tuesday it is buying U.S.-based Piedmont Lithium in a deal that will consolidate their Canadian operations while shoring up exposure to the North American electric vehicle industry, including Piedmont customer Tesla .】

item.title: 高盛董事长预计 2025 年交易量将回升
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）主席大卫-所罗门（David Solomon）周二表示，随着美国新政府的上台，2025 年的资本筹集和并购活动都将更加活跃。【原文：Goldman Sachs Chairman David Solomon said on Tuesday there will be more robust levels of both capital raising and M&A in 2025 with the new U.S. administration.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行在 11 月会议上思考利率变化方案
item.description: 路透社悉尼11月19日电）澳大利亚央行周二表示，没有立即改变利率的必要，一年来澳大利亚央行一直保持利率稳定，但重要的是要做好准备，随着经济前景的变化而采取行动。【原文：SYDNEY, Nov 19 (Reuters) - Australia's central bank said on Tuesday that there was no immediate need to change interest rates, having left them steady for a year now, but it was important to be ready to act as the economic outlook evolves.】

item.title: 美国收益率下降，亚洲股市上涨，美元走软
item.description: 亚洲股市周二上涨，而美国公债收益率和美元则从数月高位回落，交易商在等待当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的内阁人选，并试图判断美联储宽松政策的前景。【原文：Asian stocks rose on Tuesday while U.S. bond yields and the dollar hung back from multi-month highs as traders awaited President-elect Donald Trump's cabinet selection and sought to gauge the outlook for Federal Reserve easing.】

item.title: 监管机构称澳大利亚硬件连锁店 Bunnings 使用面部识别工具侵犯隐私
item.description: 澳大利亚一家监督机构发现，Wesfarmers 旗下的澳大利亚最大家居装饰连锁店 Bunnings 在未征得客户同意的情况下使用面部识别技术，侵犯了数千名客户的隐私。【原文：Wesfarmers-owned Bunnings, the country's biggest home improvement chain, breached the privacy of thousands of customers by using facial recognition technology without gaining consent, an Australian watchdog has found.】

item.title: 油价回落，但对俄乌战争仍持谨慎态度
item.description: 挪威约翰-斯维尔德鲁普（Johan Sverdrup）油田停产导致油价在前一天反弹后于周二回落，但由于担心俄乌战争可能升级，投资者仍持谨慎态度。【原文：Oil prices retreated on Tuesday after the previous day's rally driven by halted production at Norway's Johan Sverdrup oilfield, but investors remained cautious amid fears of a potential escalation in the Russia-Ukraine war.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Blackstone 接近达成 Jersey Mike's Subs 的交易
item.description: 一位熟悉此事的人士周一告诉路透社，收购公司 Blackstone 接近达成 Jersey Mike's Subs 的交易，包括债务在内，该美国三明治连锁店的估值约为 80 亿美元，最早可能在本周宣布。【原文：Buyout firm Blackstone is nearing a deal for Jersey Mike's Subs that would value the U.S. sandwich chain at around $8 billion, including debt, and could be announced as early as this week, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 北京承诺开放市场，在地缘政治忧虑中支持香港
item.description: 北京周二对华尔街高层管理人员表示，北京将推进资本市场改革和金融业对外国人的开放，同时支持香港加强其作为全球金融中心的地位。【原文：Beijing told top Wall Street executives on Tuesday that it will move ahead with capital market reforms and in the opening up of its financial sector for foreigners, while supporting Hong Kong in bolstering its credentials as a global financial hub.】

item.title: 美元涨势停滞，日元得以喘息
item.description: 日元周二获得了一些必要的喘息机会，由于美元回调，日元稳定在 1 美元兑 155 日元的强势水平。【原文：The yen got some much-needed respite on Tuesday as it steadied on the stronger side of 155 per dollar thanks to a pullback in the U.S. currency, which ran into profit-taking after a stellar rally that saw it scale a one-year high.】

item.title: 条款表显示阿里巴巴为 50 亿美元双币种债券提供初步价格指导
item.description: 据路透社周二查阅的一份条款书显示，阿里巴巴集团已向投资者提供了其 50 亿美元双币种债券的初步价格指导。【原文：Alibaba Group has delivered investors initial price guidance on its $5 billion dual currency bond, according to a term sheet reviewed by Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 调查显示，临近年底，全球雇主纷纷加大招聘力度
item.description: 周二的一项调查显示，进入今年最后一个季度后，全球各大公司都加大了专业职位的招聘力度，尤其是在零售、科技和医疗保健领域，但金融服务领域的招聘需求却较为低迷。【原文：Major global companies have boosted hiring for professional roles as they enter the final quarter of the year, especially in retail, technology and healthcare, but demand for financial services recruits is more sluggish, a survey showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普可能计划出席 SpaceX 在得克萨斯州的发射活动
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普可能计划于周二亲自参加在得克萨斯州举行的 SpaceX 火箭发射活动，这是他与该公司的亿万富翁、创始人兼首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）关系密切的又一迹象。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump may be planning to attend a SpaceX rocket launch in person in Texas on Tuesday, another sign of his close ties with the company's billionaire founder and CEO Elon Musk.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，司法部将要求法官强制谷歌出售 Chrome 浏览器
item.description: 据彭博社周一报道，美国司法部将要求法官迫使 Alphabet 公司旗下的谷歌公司出售 Chrome 浏览器。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice will ask a judge to force Alphabet Inc.'s Google to sell off its Chrome browser, Bloomberg reported on Monday.】

item.title: 中国快递集团 S.F. Holding 拟在香港上市融资最多 7.927 亿美元
item.description: 中国最大的快递公司顺丰控股周二表示，计划在香港上市，融资最多61.7亿港元（7.9271亿美元），这是香港资本市场复苏的最新迹象。【原文：China's largest express delivery company S.F. Holding , said on Tuesday it plans to raise up to HK$6.17 billion ($792.71 million) in a Hong Kong listing, the latest sign of a revival in the city's capital markets.】

item.title: 超微计算机任命德豪会计师事务所为审计师，提交纳斯达克合规计划
item.description: 超微计算机公司周一任命美国德豪会计师事务所（BDO USA）为其审计师，并表示已向纳斯达克提交了一份计划，寻求更多的时间来重新遵守上市规则。【原文：Super Micro Computer on Monday named BDO USA as its auditor and said it has submitted a plan to the Nasdaq seeking additional time to regain compliance with the listing rules, sending its shares 15% higher in extended trading.】

item.title: 日本央行将告别刺激政策时代，在政策审议中说明加息理由
item.description: 日本央行将于下月公布其在与通货紧缩长达 25 年的斗争中所使用的各种非常规货币宽松工具的利弊分析结果，这是日本央行向结束大规模刺激政策迈出的又一具有象征意义的一步。【原文：The Bank of Japan will release next month its findings on the pros and cons of the various unconventional monetary easing tools used in its 25-year battle with deflation, in another symbolic step towards ending its massive stimulus.】

item.title: 早间竞标：寻找全球方向盘，关注美联储钟摆摆动
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 搜索竞争加剧，人工智能初创公司 Perplexity 新增购物功能
item.description: 人工智能搜索初创公司Perplexity周一推出了一个购物中心来吸引用户，以加强其平台，试图与Alphabet旗下的谷歌在搜索引擎领域的主导地位抗衡。【原文：Artificial intelligence search startup Perplexity on Monday launched a shopping hub to attract users, in a bid to beef up its platform as it attempts to take on Alphabet-owned Google's dominance in the search engine space.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会指控比特矿业公司违反《反海外腐败法
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）周一表示，已指控比特矿业公司（Bit Mining）违反了《反海外腐败法》（Foreign Corrupt Practices Act），与影响日本国会议员的贿赂计划有关。【原文：The Securities and Exchange Commission has charged Bit Mining with violating the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act in connection with bribery scheme to influence members of Japanese Parliament, it said on Monday.】

item.title: ADM 在延迟发布的第三季度报告中公布利润下降
item.description: 全球谷物贸易商阿彻-丹尼尔斯-米德兰公司（Archer-Daniels-Midland）周一公布第三季度利润下降，并在其延迟提交的文件中表示，该公司已修改了分部营业利润总额的计算方法。【原文：Global grain trader Archer-Daniels-Midland posted a drop in third-quarter profit on Monday and said in its delayed filing that it has revised its calculation of total segment operating profit.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，特朗普的社交媒体集团正在洽谈收购 Bakkt
item.description: 金融时报》周一援引两位知情人士的话报道称，唐纳德-特朗普的社交媒体公司正在就收购加密货币交易公司 Bakkt 进行深入谈判。【原文：Donald Trump's social media company is in advanced talks to buy crypto trading firm Bakkt , the Financial Times reported on Monday, citing two people with knowledge of the talks.】

item.title: 新日铁不再从海外钢厂进口，以挽救美国钢铁交易
item.description: 日本新日铁公司执行副总裁森隆弘（Takahiro Mori）周一在致美国钢铁工人联合会（United Steelworkers）工会成员的一封信中表示，新日铁公司将不会从其国际钢厂向美国进口钢材。【原文：Nippon Steel will not import steel to the U.S. from its international mills, the Japanese company's Executive Vice President Takahiro Mori said on Monday in a letter to United Steelworkers union members.】
